comment: He looks tough but he is caring.  He genuinely cares for each and everyone.  He helped me and encouraged me to complete my work, so that I can pass the class.

He does have an accent that can make it hard to understand. He doesn't post any announcements or send out any emails. He is very strict on attendance. There are about 4 tests throughout the semester. He will help you out if you fail tests but only if you go to class and do the homework. Attendance is also graded. This class is a hard class.

COME TO CLASS! He does not reply to emails, but he will work with you face-to-face. He is always willing to open up homework for those who pay attention and come to class. Being mature and responsible WILL help you. His lectures were easy to understand. Use the homework to your advantage. You'd have to try to bomb this class. Very easy.
Prof is great and very caring, and he adjusts to my needs.  He learns his students and meets them accordingly.
Great to learn in person. You must get to know him first.  He works according to the students need and is flexible only for in person students.

Prepare to attend class in person, as it is a face-to-face setup. Assignments are secured with a password and can only be accessed by attending in person. The professor is approachable and easy to work with expects face-to-face interactions.  While it may seem challenging at first, I found it much easier to learn once I understood his approach.

My professor has shown good care and understanding toward my needs. When I provided a doctor's certificate, he thoughtfully accommodated my medical requirements and made the necessary adjustments. He truly is an admirable person, and I wholeheartedly recommend him to anyone. I will continue to work with integrity and honesty.

The content itself is very easy, but take the class with a different professor! If you are looking for a professor with clear communication his class is not for you. Syllabus usually doesn't align with what we actually do in the class and you will have to teach yourself the harder concepts.

He has confusing lectures that are difficult to understand, lots of homework, and does not update his syllabus or communicate with students. He will password lock assignments and you must attend all classes to get the passwords. If you never take a day off you will be okay.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very caring professor. Attendance is not completely mandatory, but it is a decent part of your grade so showing up is recommended. There are about 2-4 fairly easy MathLab/Pearson assignments a week.
Caring professor and works according to the individual needs.
Respects honest work and good attendance.

He was overall a chill professor. He gave extensions when needed, genuinely cared about you, and ensured you were ok. His overall class is fast-paced but if you go to him he is 100 % willing to reteach a topic.

I would've chosen someone else if I knew what he was like. Doesn't respond to emails, doesn't accommodate sickness, very heavy accent. He seems like a nice guy who genuinely likes math, but horrible at teaching it.

Need a laptop that was not in the syllabus which affected my grade, Does not respond to any emails, study guides do not have any answers to be able to study if you can not show, and is not clear about exams or papers.
Great Professor!! Would take class again.

Had this professor this semester and would honestly say it was great start to college. He does give homework but with good time management you can get it all done. He's also very open to answering questions and doesn't make you feel bad when you don't understand the topic. Honestly overall a nice guy and would definitely recommend his class.

Has a super heavy accent which is hard to understand. Never spent enough time with harder topics, and places tests before homework was able to be completed. Made last minute changes to the course schedule. He would pick at people's answers on the daily attendance questions if he considered the answer chosen the "obvious wrong".

He is very nice and will tell interesting stories. He does go in-depth about easier stuff and skim over hard stuff. He does have an accent but it is pretty easy to understand. He is pretty straightforward, just make sure you are always checking the homework online! Rarely there are in-class worksheets. Reading the textbook also helps!

He has an accent so you can barely understand what he's saying and just reads off powerpoint, anything u learn in this class u can online with textbook provided. spends 10 minutes explaining easy things and speeds through hard content. doesn't tell you something is due until few days before due date like my project. do not take him no matter what.
